movie_title: How Nuclear Flies Protect You from Flesh-Eating Parasites
introduction: Go to https://brilliant.org/nutshell/ to dive deeper into these topics and more with a free 30-day t

vocabulary.definition: the deliberate killing of a large number of people from a particular nation or ethnic group with the aim of destroying that nation or group.
vocabulary.example: The international community condemned the atrocities as acts of genocide.

vocabulary.definition: an organism that lives in or on another organism (its host) and benefits by deriving nutrients at the other's expense.
vocabulary.example: Malaria is caused by a parasite transmitted through mosquito bites.

vocabulary.definition: free from bacteria or other living microorganisms; totally clean.
vocabulary.example: The surgical equipment must be sterile to prevent infections.

vocabulary.definition: the emission of energy as electromagnetic waves or as moving subatomic particles, especially high-energy particles that cause ionization.
vocabulary.example: Patients undergoing cancer treatment are exposed to radiation to target and destroy cancer cells.

vocabulary.definition: destroy completely; put an end to.
vocabulary.example: Efforts to eradicate polio through vaccination campaigns have been successful in many parts of the world.

vocabulary.definition: the use of biological toxins or infectious agents such as bacteria, viruses, and fungi with the intent to kill or incapacitate humans, animals, or plants.
vocabulary.example: The Geneva Protocol of 1925 prohibits the use of biological warfare in armed conflict.
